findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the customer.

findings.title: Missing zero address validation
findings.description: Address parameters are being used without checking against the possibility of 0x0, which can lead to unwanted external calls to 0x0.

findings.title: Missing zero amount validation
findings.description: Message value is being used without checking against the possibility of 0.

findings.title: Unused libraries
findings.description: “IERC20”, “SafeERC20” and “Address” libraries have no implementation on the contract. Keeping unused libraries increases Gas costs during deployment.

findings.title: Redundant variable
findings.description: "treasuryAddress" variable has no effect on the contract logic. Keeping redundant variables increases Gas costs during deployment.
